metadata.synopsis: The party hears the voice of the Absolute, faint, in their minds.Shadowheart takes out the infernal puzzle box, it glows brighter and brighter, and then the voice stops. Player avatar questions Shadowheart about the box. If the player is not aware of Shadowheart being a Shar worshipper, then they can discover this here, if she tells them about the artefact.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Enter the goblin camp via the stone bridge after the checkpoint: 1. With an unrecruited (but alive) Shadowheart 2. With Shadowheart in the party and nearby

37.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player suddenly halts as they experience a deafening ringing sound in their head. They wince in pain.

96.text: Hear my voice. Obey my command.
96.context: CinematicNodeContext: Characters look on the verge of collapsing. NodeContext: Faint, yet authoritative. The voice of a omnipotent, yet unseen being.

86.speaker: Narrator
86.text: *The voice is irresistible. You recognise the overwhelming authority that you've used on others, only infinitely stronger, and turned against you...*
86.context: InternalNodeContext: If the player used their illithid persuasion skills before this, the narrator notes that what they're feeling now feels like the flipside of that power they used.

15.speaker: Narrator
15.text: *Your vision clouds, leaving you in a dark, featureless shadowscape. Nothingness in every direction.*
15.context: CinematicNodeContext: No cinematics until dead tribunal are designed. See state context for ongoing visual infoInternalNodeContext: These narrator nodes are intended for medium-term use until the relevant NPCs are designed and cast. Ultimately they'll be replaced with cinematics, but the narrator nodes should be recorded and included when this dialogue is patched in,

137.speaker: Narrator
137.text: *Then, there are three figures before you. An armoured male elf, exuding power and command. A handsome younger man with a quick, easy smile. And a pale young woman with even paler eyes...*
137.context: CinematicNodeContext: No cinematics until dead tribunal are designed. See state context for ongoing visual infoInternalNodeContext: These narrator nodes are intended for medium-term use until the relevant NPCs are designed and cast. Ultimately they'll be replaced with cinematics, but the narrator nodes should be recorded and included when this dialogue is patched in,

131.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player experiences a vision of Ketheric, Gortash and Orin in a TBD environment while the voice of the Absolute continues to speak. Note: glimpses of the three presented as psionic imagery.
InternalNodeContext: Cinematic node flagged impossible until cinematics can be implemented

108.text: These are my Chosen. They speak for me.

23.text: Aid their search for the Prism, and you will be worthy to stand beside them. In my presence.

162.context: CinematicNodeContext: The vision fades. The player sees that the strange box Shadowheart has is levitating before her. It's pulsing with strange, otherworldly light.

144.context: CinematicNodeContext: The vision fades. The player sees the gith artefact levitating, next to Shadowheart, who has just appeared.

77.speaker: Narrator
77.text: *You feel energy pulsing from the artefact. Lifting the pain from you. Pushing the voice away.*

31.text: My power grows. My forces gather. The reckoning draws near...
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: See state contextInternalNodeContext: Voice grows more distant, fading outNodeContext: Unfazed, assured of victory.

126.context: CinematicNodeContext: Voice, visions and pisonic magic fade entirely. The gith artefact is already back in SH's hands, and  has ceased glowing.

16.speaker: Shadowheart
16.text: Don't give me that look. I don't know what just happened any more than you do. We should keep going.
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: See state contextNodeContext: A little defensive

148.speaker: Lae'zel
148.text: The voice is gone - muted by this... this gith relic. Why does a half-elf carry it?

140.speaker: Karlach
140.text: Nice one, Shadowheart. That thing in your pocket seems powerful as hell.
140.context: NodeContext: It's a serious matter, so not too cheeky

125.speaker: Astarion
125.text: I don't know what that toy of hers is, but I'm glad it's on our side.

146.speaker: Wyll
146.text: Isn't that something? The artefact scattered the voice to the four winds.

72.speaker: Gale
72.text: That's an unusual artefact you have there, Shadowheart. A most unlikely protector...

67.speaker: Player
67.text: You've got some explaining to do first - why do you carry a gith relic?

6.speaker: Player
6.text: You've got some explaining to do first - what is that thing you have?

123.speaker: Player
123.text: The vision... that voice - what was it?

98.speaker: Shadowheart
98.text: I think that was the Absolute speaking to us... but we managed to shield ourselves. We should keep moving.
98.context: NodeContext: Troubled at what just happened, Eager to move past it.

88.speaker: Shadowheart
88.text: I'm not sure I want to know - but it's gone now. We should keep moving.
88.context: NodeContext: Troubled at what just happened, Eager to move past it.

157.speaker: Player
157.text: Hold on - that artefact seemed to stop the voice. What is it?

129.speaker: Player
129.text: That power... is that what happens to others, when we use the parasite on them?
129.context: InternalNodeContext: Available only if the party used tadpole powers on an absolute follower previously.

147.speaker: Shadowheart
147.text: Perhaps, but whatever it was, I don't want to experience it again.

166.speaker: Player
166.text: Seems that trinket's important. Keep it close.

34.speaker: Shadowheart
34.text: Trust me, I will. Let's keep going.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Hold on - at least tell me what it is first.

26.speaker: Shadowheart
26.text: I don't know... not exactly. All I know is it's important I get it back to Baldur's Gate. At any cost.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Not good enough. Explain yourself, or I'll cut you loose.

159.speaker: Shadowheart
159.text: Wait. I don't know what this thing is. All I know is that I've to get it to Baldur's Gate, at any cost. That's all I have for you.
159.context: NodeContext: Displeased, Reluctantly sharing what she knows after being issued an ultimatum.

173.speaker: Shadowheart
173.text: My home - a cloister of Shar followers, hidden in the city.

141.speaker: Player
141.text: Why Baldur's Gate? What aren't you telling me?

124.speaker: Shadowheart
124.text: I suppose if we're to continue together, I may as well tell you. I serve Shar. My home is a secret cloister in Baldur's Gate.

161.speaker: Shadowheart
161.text: A group of us were sent to retrieve the artefact. Now I'm the only one left. I can't afford to fail.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: If you don't know what it is, how do you have it?

84.speaker: Shadowheart
84.text: Because it was our mission to retrieve it - me and... the others. I'm the only one who made it.
84.context: NodeContext: hesitates and trails off at the end - about to reveal her background.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: And exactly what did retrieving the artefact entail?

65.speaker: Player
65.text: You must know something about what that thing is.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: There must be more to it - I need you to level with me.

60.speaker: Shadowheart
60.text: I... I am a servant of Shar. My home is a secret cloister in Baldur's Gate. I need to bring that artefact back there, no matter what.

169.speaker: Shadowheart
169.text: I can't tell you any more. This mission required utmost secrecy - we all submitted to having our memories suppressed so that we couldn't betray Shar's confidence.
169.context: InternalNodeContext: If the player hasn't already heard about SH's memory loss.

73.speaker: Shadowheart
73.text: If I reach my contact in the city, I'll have my memories restored. Until then, I have to guard the artefact with my life.
73.context: InternalNodeContext: If the player hasn't already heard about SH's memory loss.

22.speaker: Shadowheart
22.text: There - you have the truth, for all it's worth. Let's continue.

11.speaker: Gale
11.text: You worship Shar? Blimey. She and my beloved Mystra are not exactly friends.

163.speaker: Player
163.text: You've been lying to me. How long were you going to keep this secret?

149.speaker: Shadowheart
149.text: Forever, ideally. And you assume too much about what I can and cannot tell.

150.speaker: Shadowheart
150.text: Secrecy is everything for Shar's children. It's our code, our creed, our shield.

156.speaker: Shadowheart
156.text: I even keep secrets from myself - I had my memories suppressed, so that nothing I knew could be used against the Dark Lady. Once I prove myself, my memories will be restored.
156.context: InternalNodeContext: This node only if the memory suppression beat wasn't established

132.speaker: Shadowheart
132.text: I'm not sorry I kept this from you. Not one bit.

71.speaker: Shadowheart
71.text: Though perhaps that might change, if you can show an open mind.
71.context: NodeContext: Conceding jus a little towards the player's hurt feelings - but conditionally

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Let's see how open-minded I can be then: tell me more about your Shar worship.

48.speaker: Shadowheart
48.text: Talk to me later. We've got more pressing matters to see to right now.

134.speaker: Player
134.text: We can discuss this later. But let's just try a little more honesty going forward.

85.speaker: Shadowheart
85.text: All we can do is try, I suppose...

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I don't know how I feel about this.

75.speaker: Shadowheart
75.text: Who says you have to feel anything?

14.speaker: Shadowheart
14.text: Gather your thoughts. Then perhaps we can talk some more.

5.speaker: Player
5.text: How did you come into possession of that artefact exactly?

81.speaker: Shadowheart
81.text: There's nothing more I can tell you. All I remember is that I have to get back to my contact in the city.

54.speaker: Lae'zel
54.text: I know those symbols - githyanki runes. Ancient as Vlaakith herself. You stole that from my people.

21.speaker: Shadowheart
21.text: Yes, and a lot of my people died in the process. I won't fail them - not after what I saw your kind do to them.

120.speaker: Narrator
120.text: *A powerful artefact indeed, to have caught the attention of so many. Not least, the Absolute itself.*

58.speaker: Narrator
58.text: *The three figures in the vision - the Chosen - are searching for it. With the cultists' aid, it will not be long before they find it, before they find you.

99.speaker: Narrator
99.text: *You have evaded them so far. Thanks, it seems, to the artefact itself. But how long can such protection last?*

115.speaker: Narrator
115.text: *Shadowheart has made her position clear - she will see that it is taken to its destination. At any cost.*

45.speaker: Narrator
45.text: *No doubt the githyanki will seek to reclaim that which is theirs.*

107.speaker: Narrator
107.text: *And you still do not know what it even is.*

74.speaker: Player
74.text: Enough, both of you. We need to work together.

110.speaker: Lae'zel
110.text: For now. But any crimes against my kin will be answered for, in time.

49.speaker: Shadowheart
49.text: I just saved you. Keep that in mind, next time you want to air your grievances.
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at Lae'zelNodeContext: Sharp retort

118.speaker: Shadowheart
118.text: Agreed. There's too much at stake for petty squabbles.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Keep that thing safe - seems we'll need it.

41.speaker: Shadowheart
41.text: Trust me, I'll guard it with my life. Let's keep going.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Give me the artefact. Better if I hold onto it.

79.speaker: Shadowheart
79.text: I trust you more than most, but I'm sorry - that's too much to ask. This is my responsibility.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Just take care of it. Seems like it's as important to me as it is to you.

25.speaker: Shadowheart
25.text: I wouldn't quite say that, but it'll be safe with me. Let's go.

155.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart puts the box away

47.speaker: Player
47.text: I can't trust you. Best if we travel separately for now.

101.speaker: Shadowheart
101.text: If you insist. Don't expect to fare well without me to save you.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I want to know about your Shar worship before we go any farther.
36.context: InternalNodeContext: SH's Shar worship wasn't discussed yet.

117.speaker: Shadowheart
117.text: If you insist. But make it quick - we have far bigger concerns.

40.speaker: Shadowheart
40.text: Out of the question. This is my mission - I won't just give it away.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Tell me about the artefact. What just happened?

24.speaker: Player
24.text: It's been some time since I met another faithful of Shar. Are you versed in her teachings?

171.speaker: Shadowheart
171.text: Of course I am. But we can talk about this later - let's go.

153.speaker: Player
153.text: I don't care who you worship. Tell me about that artefact.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: I didn't agree to join up with a Shar worshipper.

69.speaker: Shadowheart
69.text: Then it's your own fault for not asking.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: Now that the truth's out, tell me more.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: In future, I expect you to be honest. Let's leave it at that for now.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Your faith is your own concern, not mine.

20.speaker: Shadowheart
20.text: True. I didn't think you'd react so pragmatically. Perhaps I should have told you sooner.

170.speaker: Player
170.text: Shar is an abomination. You deceived me.

145.speaker: Shadowheart
145.text: Your blindness as much as my deception, Selûnite. We can talk about this later - if you're willing.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: I bow to Shar also. The Dark Lady must favour us, to have brought us together.

42.speaker: Shadowheart
42.text: I... yes, she must. I'll offer thanks to her in my prayers - and we should speak more later. Alone, ideally.

56.speaker: Shadowheart
56.text: No need to thank me - this is out of pure necessity - pure desperation, in fact.

78.speaker: Wyll
78.text: A Shar worshipper? Not my usual quarry - nor my usual ally.

168.speaker: Astarion
168.text: Heavens forbid. We're all entitled to our secrets.

119.speaker: Karlach
119.context: NodeContext: Reacting to the revelation Shadowheart is a Sharran. Karlach might be a little awkwardly victorious here; this isn't the right time for her outburst.

57.speaker: Lae'zel
57.text: The goddess of secrets? How telling.

111.speaker: Shadowheart
111.text: Then go ahead. It won't change what I have to say to you.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: I'll have answers, or I'll have blood.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: That was far from nothing. Tell me what you know, please.

94.speaker: Shadowheart
94.text: I told you already, now forget it. Let's keep going.

133.speaker: Shadowheart
133.text: I imagine you must have questions. We should talk.

87.speaker: Narrator
87.text: *The voice is irresistible. Every word is drenched with a power and authority that you do not understand, but cannot deny.*
87.context: InternalNodeContext: The player hasn't used their illithid powers
